thread.title: Amber cold alert issued for Kent as temperatures to plunge to -4°C
thread.title_full: Amber cold alert issued for Kent as temperatures to plunge to -4°C

author: Millie Bowles
title: Amber cold alert issued for Kent as temperatures to plunge to -4°C
text:
An amber "cold health alert" has been issued for the county, with warnings of an increase in deaths among the elderly and extra demand on hospitals. An amber "cold health alert" has been issued for the whole county, with warnings of an increase in deaths among the elderly and extra demand on hospitals.
The Met Office and the government upped their warning from yellow to the more serious rating today.
Temperatures are set to drop to -4°C
It covers the whole of the UK, with temperatures set to drop to as low as -4°C in Kent.
The alert is in place from today until Wednesday, January 8.
Temperatures inthe county are set to hit lows of -4°C tomorrow morning, with a 'feels like' forecast of -7°C.
There is also a weather warning for snow and ice for Saturday and Sunday.
It covers most of the county, with the exception of Romney…
Millie Bowles
